creates root yarn.lock
- Child yarn.lock files are only created when running yarn inside
packages (useful when adding a dependency to one of the packages) 
already inconsistent
- But when running yarn inside a package, the sibling deps are
installed from the npm repository instead of being linked, which means
theyll bring along the dependencies of the last published version
- Removing a 3rd party dependency in one of the leaf packages becomes
impossible because the other dependent packages will freeze the old
dependencies of the leaf package until it is published again
